resources.string: Which Indian food you\nlike to cook?

Data Collection: Check what kind of data the app collects. This may include personal information like your name, email address, or even your location.
 Third-party Sharing: Find out if the app shares your data with third parties, such as advertisers or analytics companies.
 Data Storage: Know where your data is stored and how it is protected. Make sure the app uses encryption to keep your information safe.
 Permissions: Be aware of the permissions the app requires. Some apps may ask for access to your camera, microphone, or contacts, which could potentially compromise your privacy.
 Opt-out Options: Look for options to opt out of data collection or to delete your account if you no longer want to use the app.
 Privacy Policy: Always read the app privacy policy to understand how your data is used and protected. Make sure you are comfortable with the terms before using the app
